citation.article-title: Clostridium amylolyticum sp. nov., isolated from H2-producing UASB granules.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Clostridium amylolyticum sp. nov.
Clostridium amylolyticum (am.y.lo.ly′ti.cum. Gr. n. amulon starch; Gr. adj. lutikos able to loosen, able to dissolve; N.L. neut. adj. amylolyticum starch-dissolving).
Gram-reaction-positive, motile rods.
Peritrichous flagella.
Obligately anaerobic.
Oxidase and catalase are not produced.
Optimum growth occurs at 37 °C (no growth at or below 22 °C or at or above 47 °C).
The pH range for growth is 4.0–9.0 (no growth at or below pH 3.6 or at or above pH 9.3), with optimum growth at pH 7.0.
Chemo-organotrophic.
Peptone may serve as a nitrogen source.
Produces ethanol, acetate, hydrogen and carbon dioxide from glucose fermentation.
Hydrolyses aesculin and starch, but not gelatin.
Milk reaction is negative.
Utilizes glucose, ribose, galactose, fructose, mannose, mannitol, sucrose, cellobiose, lactose, maltose and trehalose, but not glycerol, xylose, arabinose, sorbitol, rhamnose, xylan or cellulose.
Complex substrates such as yeast extract and peptone are fermented.
Nitrate is not reduced.
H2S, but not indole, is produced from peptone/yeast extract/glucose medium.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are C14 : 0 (36.5 %), C16 : 0 (21.0 %), C16 : 1ω7c/C15 : 0 iso 2-OH (12.7 %), C12 : 0 (4.8 %) and C18 : 1ω9c (4.3 %).
The type strain, SW408T (=JCM 14823T=AS 1.5069T=CGMCC 1.5069T), was isolated from granules of a laboratory-scale H2-producing UASB reactor at ambient temperature.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 33.1 mol% (Tm method).
